sentences.english: They also increase alertness and energy.
sentences.chinese: 它们也能提高机敏性和精力。

sentences.english: A quick-witted neighbor heard the screams and called the police.
sentences.chinese: 一位机敏的邻居听到尖叫声后便打电话叫来了警察。

sentences.english: Her tactfulness is a remarkable gift.
sentences.chinese: 她的机敏是一种非凡的天赋。

sentences.english: Mr. A is a gleg man of a jocose nature.
sentences.chinese: 先生是一位天生诙谐而反应机敏的人。

sentences.english: The race is timed, but the emphasis is on agility.
sentences.chinese: 这场比赛是限时的，重点在于机敏。

sentences.english: Although hes over eighty his mind is still remarkably alert.
sentences.chinese: 他虽已年过八十，但头脑仍然十分机敏。

sentences.english: A quick wit with a light touch, he was dealt, in many ways, a fortunate hand at birth.
sentences.chinese: 他机敏巧智，从多方面讲，一出生就应天承运。

sentences.english: Those people who live sensibly and sanely day after day.
sentences.chinese: 那些日复一日生活在机敏与理智里的人之一。

sentences.english: They are always sensitive and intelligent and good at sailing and the Australian crawl.
sentences.chinese: 伊多机敏睿智，喜好帆船运动与澳式爬泳。

sentences.english: He showed similar adroitness and persistence in strategic arm control .
sentences.chinese: 在战略武器方面，他显示出了同样的机敏和执著。

sentences.english: What makes it a little more tricky is learning when to violate this principle.
sentences.chinese: 机敏的是学会何时违反这些原则。

sentences.english: She is calm and resourceful in an emergency.
sentences.chinese: 她在紧急关头总是沉着机敏。

sentences.english: Although he's over eighty his mind is still remarkably alert.
sentences.chinese: 他虽已年逾八十，但头脑仍十分机敏。

sentences.english: He had an incisive, quickmotioned, self-sufficient manner .
sentences.chinese: 他具有机敏，轻捷，矜持的态度。

sentences.english: Nato, he said, was being astute and would "take information from any source it can.
sentences.chinese: 北约组织，非常机敏并能够‘尽其所能’地搜集情报。

definition: to surpass others/outstanding/(basketball, soccer etc) to get past an opponent
quick witted/able to think fast in an emergency
